comments.body:
@rafaelblink I was not able to see the `Move to queue` button, because the `routeConfig` property wasn't getting set up here :top:. 

[This](https://github.com/RocketChat/Rocket.Chat/pull/21285/files#diff-7ea22d1f2dc14b7eb09df59074efe4d9a43c96cce7e9008e92e9b792fe13c56cR201) was the check that was failing. `routeConfig` was undefined here
Can you please verify if that's not the case anymore? If so, I'll revert the change

@renatobecker I made this change because the `Move Queue` button wasn't visible in the header when I have Manual Selection Routing Method selected

**Actual Behaiour**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34130764/112425544-4475a380-8d5c-11eb-93f8-b5fbc9886673.png)

**Expected Behaviour**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34130764/112425618-64a56280-8d5c-11eb-84b8-00624d5065fa.png)

Yeah, I got your point, that's the reason whe're sharing with you the right way to get the information you need, that's through the Omnichannel contexts. You just need to import it use it properly.

https://github.com/RocketChat/Rocket.Chat/blob/develop/client/contexts/OmnichannelContext.ts#L22
